intro: Timonius ngoyensis, commonly known as the Ngoye's timonius, is a rare and lesser-known plant species native to the tropical rainforests of Central Africa. It belongs to the family Araliaceae, which includes a variety of flowering plants known for their diverse morphological features. The plant typically features compound leaves with a distinctive arrangement of lobes, and its flowers are small and clustered in umbels. Timonius ngoyensis is characterized by its unique adaptation to the humid and nutrient-rich environments of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
